intro: Chiococca brachiata var. biformis, commonly known as the two-branched chiococca, is a climbing plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
